result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam A Dronso was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Adam A Dronso is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Adam A Dronso was found guilty of Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
$3,145.00 or any other amount which Guaranty Bank submits, payable to Guaranty Bank, which will be determined on next day.  Payable by January 26, 2016.  Nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
Hearing 11/10/15.

Pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments, DNA surcharge. To be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be pad during term of Extended Supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with cases 14CF5521 and 15CF1638*; consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full time, defendant to have a part time job.
Mental health assessment. Cooperate with any recommended teatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating physician.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
No contact with Gary J. and his business.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Cooperate with agent.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised the defendnt that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Defendant Adam A Dronso in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The restitution in the amount of $3,145.00 previoulsy set at Sentencing on 10-28-2015 will remain the same.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Adam A Dronso in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Defendant Adam A Dronso in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Pursuant to plea negotations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 2, 3 and 4 be DISMISSED.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY TO COUNT 1.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty on COUNT 1 as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  Additional statement by Bernadine D.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 53 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 17 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 36 MONTHS, concurrent with cases 14CF5521 and 15CF2638, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $3,145.00 or any other amount which Guaranty Bank submits, payable to Guaranty Bank; which will be determined on next day; payable by January 26, 2016; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating physician
-No contact with Gary J. and his business
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances.

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor;p also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restore

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
